SQL date time format

ğŸ‘¤ Shao Zelian | ğŸ“… Created: 2025-05-31 | ğŸ“… Last updated: 2026-01-08 | ğŸ·ï¸ Tags: Database
Use CONVERT function for the formatting of date time type in T-SQL

CONVERT function | CONVERT(nvarchar(10), count_time, 121)

1st arg size after conversion.
2nd arg target date time.
3rd arg format.

Hereâ€™s the format table

Number Code Format
0 0 or 100 mon dd yyyy hh:miAM(æˆ–PM)
1 101 mm/dd/yy
2 102 yy-mm-dd
3 103 dd/mm/yy
4 104 dd-mm-yy
5 105 dd-mm-yy
6 106 dd mon yy
7 107 mon dd,yy
8 108 hh:mm:ss
9 9 or 109 mon dd yyyy hh:mi:ss:mmmmAM(æˆ–PM)
10 110 mm-dd-yy
11 111 yy/mm/dd
12 112 yymmdd
11 13 or 113 dd mon yyyy hh:mi:ss:mmm(24å°æ—¶åˆ¶)
14 114 hh:mi:ss:mmm(24å°æ—¶åˆ¶)
15 20 or 120 yyyy-mm-dd hh:mi:ss(24å°æ—¶åˆ¶)
16 21 or 121 yyyy-mm-dd hh:mi:ss:mmm(24å°æ—¶åˆ¶)

Samples

SQL Output
SELECT CONVERT ( varchar (100), GETDATE(), 0) 05 16 2006 10:57AM
SELECT CONVERT ( varchar (100), GETDATE(), 1) 05/16/06
SELECT CONVERT ( varchar (100), GETDATE(), 2) 06.05.16
SELECT CONVERT ( varchar (100), GETDATE(), 3) 16/05/06
SELECT CONVERT ( varchar (100), GETDATE(), 4) 16.05.06
SELECT CONVERT ( varchar (100), GETDATE(), 5) 16-05-06
SELECT CONVERT ( varchar (100), GETDATE(), 6) 16 05 06
SELECT CONVERT ( varchar (100), GETDATE(), 7) 05 16, 06
SELECT CONVERT ( varchar (100), GETDATE(), 8) 10:57:46
SELECT CONVERT ( varchar (100), GETDATE(), 9) 05 16 2006 10:57:46:827AM
SELECT CONVERT ( varchar (100), GETDATE(), 10) 05-16-06
